item.title: FranetiC - Singularity - Episode 124 [ Progressive | Uplifting | Psy | Hard Trance ]
item.dc:creator: franetic
item.description:
Welcome to August’s episode of the Franetic Podcast

From 132 to 145 beats per minute - something to get you going on a Saturday night. Some epic remixes in here alongside some storming newbies, ending on some proper hard stuff!

Enjoy….

1] Ryoji Takahashi & Dimension - Hidamari (Original Mix)
2] The Thrillseekers & Hydra - Amber (Extended mix)

6] Liquid Soul - Sweet Things (Morten Granau & Metronome Remix)
7] Guy Barone feat. Katty Heath - You Make It Hurt (Allen & Envy Remix)
8] Andy Moor & Orkedia - Year Zero (Mike San [...]

item.title: FranetiC - Unanimity - Episode 123 [ Progressive | Tech | Psy | Uplifting | Hard Trance ]
item.dc:creator: franetic
item.description:
Hello Trance lovers,
This is Episode 123 - Unanimity - a mind bending tour through the caverns of sound.

A 123 minute mega mix for you to plug in and let go too, starting things off with a few progressive sounds and building up to some rather filthy Hard Trance - stopping off along the way in the realms of Tech Trance, Psy Trance and Uplifting Trance…

3,2,1, GO….

1] Andy Moor & Orkidea - Year Zero (Kajis 2.0 Remix)
2] Rank 1 - Superstring (Extended Mix)
3] Tomcraft - Loneliness ((Klub Cut)
4] Gareth Emery feat. Janet Devlin -  Lost (Ferry Corsten Remix)
[...]

item.title: FranetiC - Liquified [ Progressive | Uplifting | Tech Trance ]
item.dc:creator: franetic
item.description:
Welcome to the next instalment of the Franetic Podcast… After a completely mental week preceded by the awesome Godskitchen ‘The Last Dance’, the global club giant has been committed to the embers of the past - but the music LIVES! Let me take you on a musical tour that is TRANCE. <3

128BPM to 141BPM in just over an hour, this is a perpetual winding up mix from Progressive, to Uplifting to the Techy stuff…. 

1] Jennifer Rene & Solid Stone - Pushing Up (Original Mix)
2] Orkidea - Nana (Jerome Isme-Ae Remix) 
3] Maor Levi & Ilan Bluestone - Shake The Air (Daun Giventi Remix)
4] 4 Strings - Sunset Aftermath (Original Mix)
5] M-Shame - Dreamwave (Original Mix)
6] F.G. Noise - Recover (Original Mix)
7] Marc Et Claude - La (Brett Wood DJ Tool)
8] Richard Durand - Richochet (2nd Phase Remix) 
9] Tiesto - Traffic (Richard Durand Remix)

item.title: FranetiC - Primordial [ Tough Progressive | Tech | Psy | Uplifting | Hard Trance ]
item.dc:creator: franetic
item.description:
Welcome to the weekend - well, the middle of it - in the UK anyway!
I have made a surprise episode! I have been doing them monthly in the past year so this one is a leetle early, I just found some absolute belters I thought I would have a productive weekend and grace your ears with all the delights I have found. 

Straight in with the tough stuff- quite techy this time around - MaRLo can stay, what a whopper with Darkside. Not much in to what he has been churning out recently until this BEAST! LOVE LOVE LOVE… Some epic uplifters in here and some classics too - ending with a small tradition I seem to have built in to the past few eps, something from the man Scot Project - his remix of Universal Music! 

Enjoy guys… 

1] Corty - Scrape (Original Mix)
2] Gareth Emery & Ben Gold - Until We Meet Again (Original Mix)
3] Brian Kearny & Will Atk [...]
item.content:encoded:
Welcome to the weekend - well, the middle of it - in the UK anyway!
I have made a surprise episode! I have been doing them monthly in the past year so this one is a leetle early, I just found some absolute belters I thought I would have a productive weekend and grace your ears with all the delights I have found. 

Straight in with the tough stuff- quite techy this time around - MaRLo can stay, what a whopper with Darkside. Not much in to what he has been churning out recently until this BEAST! LOVE LOVE LOVE… Some epic uplifters in here and some classics too - ending with a small tradition I seem to have built in to the past few eps, something from the man Scot Project - his remix of Universal Music! 

Enjoy guys… 

1] Corty - Scrape (Original Mix)
2] Gareth Emery & Ben Gold - Until We Meet Again (Original Mix)
3] Brian Kearny & Will Atkinson - The Game Changer (Original Mix)
4] Chris Bekker - Goldelse (Original Mix)
5] Alex Daf & Iversoon - Atom (Original Mix)
6] MaRLo - Darkside (Original Mix)
7] Naturalize - Deep Down (Original Mix)
8] Tilt - I Dream (Nicholas Bennison Remix)
9] Bjorn Akesson - Paper Dreams (Original Mix)
10] Funabashi & Saltwater - Legacy 2.0 (Alphazone Remix)
11] Peaktwins - Dreamer (Original Mix)
12] Ralph Novell - Wrong Love (Alphazone Remix)
13] Will Atkinson - Harvester (Original Mix)
14] Meteor Seven - Universal Music (Scot Project Remix)

item.title: FranetiC - Bintang - Episode 120 [ Progressive | Uplifting | Psy | Tech | Hard Trance ]
item.dc:creator: franetic
item.description:
Hey hey everybuuuuudy!

I hope you are all having a great weekend thus far! 

Here is the latest episode in the FranetiC podcast saga - ‘Bintang’ the Indonesian word for star, taking you on yet another cosmic journey through Trance <3

This mix again follows suit with recent tradition in that we start off with some progressive loveliness at around 130bpm and winde up to some old skool classics - including the legend that was; Tillman Urchmacher - On The Run, which is one of my all time favourite tunes; for some reason I have not played yet. We end this episode on some classic Hard Trance from the early naughties! I hope you enjoy…

xXx

1] Cres [...]
item.content:encoded:
Hey hey everybuuuuudy!

I hope you are all having a great weekend thus far! 

Here is the latest episode in the FranetiC podcast saga - ‘Bintang’ the Indonesian word for star, taking you on yet another cosmic journey through Trance <3

This mix again follows suit with recent tradition in that we start off with some progressive loveliness at around 130bpm and winde up to some old skool classics - including the legend that was; Tillman Urchmacher - On The Run, which is one of my all time favourite tunes; for some reason I have not played yet. We end this episode on some classic Hard Trance from the early naughties! I hope you enjoy…

xXx

1] Cressida - Summit (Original Mix)
2] Darren Round - Horizon (Original Mix)
3] Dan Dobson - Docile [Extended Mix)
4] Jordan Suckley - Who Cares (The Technicians Remix)
5] Armin Van Buuren - Shivers (Dan Thompson Extended Remix)
6] Avengers - Tomorrow People (Original Mix)
7] UCast - Gearbox (Extended Mix)
8] Jose Amnesia - The Eternal (Scott Bond & Charlie Walker Reebooted Remix
9) Paul Denton - Searching The Sky (Original Mix)
10] Lostly - Du Bist Okay (Indecent Noise Edit)
11] Ferry Corsten - Beautiful (Aly & Fila Remix)
12] Tillman Urchmacher - On The Run (Ocean To Shore Club Extended)
13] S.H.O.K.K - Folie a Duex (Klub Mix)
14] Scot Project - L [I Want Your Love] (Original Mix)

item.title: FranetiC - A Brief History of Trance 1 - ARCHIVE from November 2011 [ Classic Trance | Anthems ]
item.dc:creator: franetic
item.description: Hey guys - since the move to Podbean a few of my most popular mixes have dropped off iTunes - so at a request I am uploading this episode from my series Brief History of Trance (Only two of them!), the first ever one I did back in 2011. It was my most popular episode ever getting nearly a million downloads on Podomatic. It features some of my all time favourite classics mixed chronologically from 1993 to 2011.
item.content:encoded:
Hey guys - since the move to Podbean a few of my most popular mixes have dropped off iTunes - so at a request I am uploading this episode from my series Brief History of Trance (Only two of them!), the first ever one I did back in 2011. It was my most popular episode ever getting nearly a million downloads on Podomatic. It features some of my all time favourite classics mixed chronologically from 1993 to 2011.


The original blurb with it…..


Of course Trance goes back to the Acid House era in its earliest forms, being heard from about the mid eighties. But the sound really came to fruition in my opinion when Paul Van Dyk released his remix of Humate - Love Stimulation in 1993, definitely the pioneer of the current sound, bringing the european sound completely to the forefront of the trance scene. I have recorded a mix in complete chronological order, with one track selected from each year since 1993 up to the present day. All my own personal preferences and aren’t necessarily actual number one tracks from each year, although most of course are recognised and were hits in the scene in various forms over the years. And the cover of course drawing a little inspiration from Stephen Hawkings book, a Brief History of Time…..

Enjoy the history  xXx

1) Humate – Love stimulation (Paul Van Dyk Mix) (1993)

2) Paul Van Dyk – For an Angel (Original Mix) (1994) 

3) Libra Presents Taylor - Calling Your Name (Granny Mix) (1995) 

4) Nalin and Kane – Beachball (Original Extended Vocal Mix) (1996) 

5) Three Drives - Greece 2000 (Original Mix) (1997) 

6) Binary Finary - Binary Finary (Pvd Mix) (1998) 

7) Solar Stone – Seven Cities (Original Mix) (1999) 

8) Lange Feat. The Morrighan – Follow Me (Original Mix) (2000) 

9) DJ Tiesto – Suburban Train (Radio Edit Mix) (2001) 

10) Paul Oakenfold – Southern Sun (Tiesto mix) (2002) 

11) Motorcycle - As The rush comes (Above and Beyond’s Dynaglide Mix (2003) 

12) Agnelli and Nelson – Holding on to Nothing (Original Mix) (2004) 

13) Reflekt - Need To Feel Loved (Thrillseekers Mix) (2005) 

14) Armin Van Buuren – Shivers (Alex M.O.R.P.H Remix) (2006) 

15) Thomas Bronzwaer – Constellation (Original Mix) (2007) 

16) Simon Patterson - Us (Original Mix) (2008) 

17) Gareth Emery – Exposure (Original Mix) (2009) 

18) Myon and Shane 54 feat. Labworks - Ibiza Sunrise (Classic Mix) (2010) 

19) Spaio & Sleazy Tek feat. Susie Ledge - Your only one (Carl Fath Remix) (2011)

item.title: FranetiC - Oblivion - Episode 119 [ Progressive | Uplifting | Psy | Tech | Hard Trance ]
item.dc:creator: franetic
item.description:
Hey hey hey!

I am back from an amazing adventure to Indonesia - one of the most beautiful places I have ever been, both landscape and people. <3
So now in a new home of Podbean (I hope this works!) first new episode since the transfer, I very m [...]
item.content:encoded:
Hey hey hey!

I am back from an amazing adventure to Indonesia - one of the most beautiful places I have ever been, both landscape and people. <3
So now in a new home of Podbean (I hope this works!) first new episode since the transfer, I very much hope it reaches everyone who subscribed to me on Podomatic. 
I have had a wealth of tracks to sift through, some absolute belters going on at the moment! Welcome to OBLIVION! Winding you up in the usual manner all the way from 130bpm to 145bpm - Progressive Trance to some classic Hard Trance and everything in-between!
On to the music…
1: DRYM - Love (Extended Mix)
2: Faithless - Salva Mea 2.0 (Above & Beyond Remix)
3: Driftmoon - Waves (Original Mix)
4: Nic Chagall - What You Need (Marco V Remix)
5: Andy Moor - Resurrection (Indecent Noise Remix)
6: Kingpink - Phallusophy (Original Mix)
7: Sean Tyas - Reach Out (Giuseppi Ottaviani) 
8: The Thrillseekers - Just Beacuse (Original Mix)
9: Paul Oakenfold - Bla Bla Bla (Original mix)
10: Jochen Miller - Lost Connection (Andreas Sanchex Uplifting Remix)
11: Orla Feeny & Kristina Sky - Insubordinate (Original Mix)
12: Lostly - Coffin Corner (Original Mix)
13: Derb - Follow Me (Psyburst Remix)
14: Kai Tracid - Trance & Acid (Original Mix) 
15: S.H.O.K.K - Isn’ Everything A Little Strange (Krazy Nut Mix)

item.title: FranetiC - A Brief History of Trance 2 - Episode 118
item.dc:creator: franetic
item.description: A History of Trance returns with the second instalment - 2011 was the last edition, journeying from 1993 to 2011. This new episode is a bit of a monster - prepare for some commitment for the next 2.5 hours! This mix takes you on a chronological journey year on year from 1991 to 2015; a track for each year except 2000 where I honestly couldn’t pick the two so just smashed them both in- so its a double whammy on the year 2000 - what the hell, it was one of the best years for Trance. 26 stompers in total for you to wrap your lobes around….The same as last time the tracks are all my own personal preferences and aren’t necessarily actual number one tracks from each year, although most of course are recognised and were hits in the scene in various forms over the years. Enjoy [...]
item.content:encoded: A History of Trance returns with the second instalment - 2011 was the last edition, journeying from 1993 to 2011. This new episode is a bit of a monster - prepare for some commitment for the next 2.5 hours! This mix takes you on a chronological journey year on year from 1991 to 2015; a track for each year except 2000 where I honestly couldn’t pick the two so just smashed them both in- so its a double whammy on the year 2000 - what the hell, it was one of the best years for Trance. 26 stompers in total for you to wrap your lobes around….The same as last time the tracks are all my own personal preferences and aren’t necessarily actual number one tracks from each year, although most of course are recognised and were hits in the scene in various forms over the years. Enjoy xXx1991: Dance 2 Trance - We Came In Peace (1991 Mix) 1992: The Age Of Love - The Age Of Love (Watch Out For Stella Club Mix) 1993: Quench – Dreams (Original Mix) 1994: Li Kwan – Point Zero (Original Mix)1995: X-Cabs – Neuro (Original Mix)1996: JX - There’s Nothing I Won’t Do (Red Jerry & JX Dub)1997: Three’N One Presents Jonny Shaker - Pearl Rover (Vocal Mix)1998: Westbam vs Red Jerry - Wizards of the Sonic (Matt Darey mix)1999: Blockster - Groovline (Matt Darey Remix)2000: Nordlander - Starchild (Original Mix)2000 X2: Lightforce – Join Me (Pants and Corsett Remix) 2001: Push – The Legacy (2001 Remake)2002: Hemstock and Jennings – Arctic (Original Mix)2003: Solid Globe - North Pole (Original Mix)2004: Alphazone – Flashback (Original Mix)2005: Marcel Woods – Cherry Blossom (Original Mix)2006: Nic Chagall - Monday Bar (Original Mix)2007: Onova ‎– Platitude (Original Mix)2008: Above & Beyond pres Oceanlab - Breaking Ties (Above & Beyond Analogue Haven Mix)2009: Roger Shah & Signum - Healesville Sanctuary (Roger Shah Mix)2010: Alpha Duo - The Unspoken (Original Mix)2011: Daniel Kandi - Soul Searchin’ (Original Mix) 2012: Broning – Re-inspired (Original Mix)2013: Johann Stone vs Joey V – Moondancer (Original Mix)2014: UCast - Slipstream (Original Mix)2015: The Thrillseekers Vs Sam Mitcham - They’ll Never Know (Original Mix)

Enjoy ;) xXx1991: Dance 2 Trance - We Came In Peace (1991 Mix) 1992: The Age Of Love - The Age Of Love (Watch Out For Stella Club Mix) 1993: Quench – Dreams (Original Mix) 1994: Li Kwan – Point Zero (Original Mix)1995: X-Cabs – Neuro (Original Mix)1996: JX - There’s Nothing I Won’t Do (Red Jerry JX Dub)1997: Three’N One Presents Jonny Shaker - Pearl Rover (Vocal Mix)1998: Westbam vs Red Jerry - Wizards of the Sonic (Matt Darey mix)1999: Blockster - Groovline (Matt Darey Remix)2000: Nordlander - Starchild (Original Mix)2000 X2: Lightforce – Join Me (Pants and Corsett Remix) 2001: Push – The Legacy (2001 Remake)2002: Hemstock and Jennings – Arctic (Original Mix)2003: Solid Globe - North Pole (Original Mix)2004: Alphazone – Flashback (Original Mix)2005: Marcel Woods – Cherry Blossom (Original Mix)2006: Nic Chagall - Monday Bar (Original Mix)2007: Onova ‎– Platitude (Original Mix)2008: Above Beyond pres Oceanlab - Breaking Ties (Above Beyond Analogue Haven Mix)2009: Roger Shah Signum - Healesville Sanctuary (Roger Shah Mix)2010: Alpha Duo - The Unspoken (Original Mix)2011: Daniel Kandi - Soul Searchin' (Original Mix) 2012: Broning – Re-inspired (Original Mix)2013: Johann Stone vs Joey V – Moondancer (Original Mix)2014: UCast - Slipstream (Original Mix)2015: The Thrillseekers Vs Sam Mitcham - They'll Never Know (Original Mix)

item.title: FranetiC - Continuum - Episode 117 [ Tough | Psy | Uplifting | Tech Trance ]
item.dc:creator: franetic
item.description:
It’s double trouble this weekend, as well as a guest mix released previous to this here is my own addition to the pot, so…. Trance lovers, here is the next instalment of the Franetic Podcast - I wish you an awesome weekend of sun, fun and frolics (For those of you in the Northern Hemisphere) and for those south of the equator Merry Wintermus and a happy new summer to come!

From the tough stuff, to the uplifting stuff let me take you on a journey through sound….

Enjoy xXx

1) Stoneface & Terminal - Venus (2015 Rework) 2) Mars Attack - HoHo (Original Mix) 3) Airscape & Peetu S - Pianomatic (Airscape Festival Remix) 4) The Thrillseekers & Sam Mitcham - They’ll Never Know (Original Mix) 5) K-Narf - Hypogogia (Original Mix) 6) Krama - F [...]

Trance lovers, here is the next instalment of the Franetic Podcast - I wish you an awesome weekend of sun, fun and frolics (For those of you in the Northern Hemisphere) and for those south of the equator Merry Wintermus and a happy new summer to come!

From the tough stuff, to the uplifting stuff let me take you on a journey through sound….

(Original Mix) 12) Bryan Kearney - Wake Up (Original Mix)

item.title: DJ Smoothound - Thumpers Revisited Guest Mix - Episode 116 [ Hard House | Bounce ]
item.dc:creator: franetic
item.description:
Back to the Old Skool! Time to journey back to the 90’s with this almighty guest mix.

This has been in the pipeline for a wee while, from the legend that is DJ Smoothound. From first seeing him play in Monastery when I was a a young spring chicken back in 1999, he was one of the inspirations which made me want to become a DJ.

No tracklist I am afraid - purely vinyl from back in the day, much of it white label.

One coming from me in the next week or so back to the realms of Trance.

Enjoy xXx

item.dc:creator: franetic
item.description: This is episode 115 - I have had to re-upload due to a glitch which only allowed the first 43 mins to be played and downloaded. Kicking things off with a retro 80’s sounding track from Orkidea, progressing through some uplifting, psy and tech trancers. I have had a few excellent promo’s for this edition from the likes of Harmonic Rush & Binary Finary. item.title: FranetiC - Exo - Episode 114 [ Progressive | Psy | Uplifting | Tech Trance ]
item.dc:creator: franetic
item.description:
Welcome to the next instalment of the Franetic Podcast…. Can you also believe I have been podcasting now for coming up 5 years!? Now that is crazy, anyway….. A journey from the light to the dark, to transport you to another world of Trance. Delving in to the progressive sounds of Mat Zo, a trip back in time to the likes of Sander Van Doorn’s Bastillion, all the way through to the techy hard stuff of Kamui (2008) Spielzeug.

Enjoy xXx

Tracklisting:

1) Matt Zo - 24 Hours [ Rank1 Remix ] 2) The Technicians - Re:Sample [ Radio Edit ] 3) Sander Van Doorn - Bastillion [ Original mix ] 4) Ticon - Ether [ Original Mix ] 5) Good Fellas - Quadraculture [ Original Mix ] 6) Ghost Rider & Omiki - One Way [ Original Mix ] 7) Aimoon - The Run [ Original Mix ] 8) Will Atkinson - The Pain [ Original Mix ] 9) Sean Tyas - Way Down in Mexico [ Origin [...]

item.description:
This is ‘The Hunter’. Apologies for the big delay between episodes! I have been a busy bee of late! I hope to get some more to you a little more regularly from now….

I have had a treasure trove of tracks to choose from, here are some of the besties, in my opinion anyhoo….

Enjoy, fellow Earthlings….

xXx

item.description:
Merry Valentine-mus to all, whether you be a single free bird or a loved up couple of love birds. I wish you a happy day no matter what…

Episode 112 for you, totally seeing stars with this one. Some utterly awesome teeeeyoooons for you to wrap your lil lobes around. Kittens for everybody!!!!

item.title: FranetiC - The Speed Of Dark - Episode 111 [ Progressive | Uplifting | Psy | Tech | Hard Trance ]
item.dc:creator: franetic
item.description: So here is my first episode of 2015 - being British and looking at many of my past podcast descriptions, I feel the need to apologise for it’s lateness - Its something to do with British people that’s for sure, I was walking up the stairs at work yesterday and as I passed someone on the stairs they apologised to me. Unless they know something I don’t, I am finding it more and more strange! Maybe I am fatter than I think!Soooooo, thats a ramble done. Tunes! Starting at 129BPM and winding up to 142BPM, I have recorded a 124 minute 25 track mega mix for you! It starts progressive and journeys through the scales of Trance all the way to a rather oldskool almost DJ Isaac-esque sounding hard trancer at the end from Indecent Noise. It was an auditory treat to mix for you guys - This is ‘The Speed Of Dark’, I hope you enjoy it! xXx1) Dave Walker - Man [...]
item.content:encoded: So here is my first episode of 2015 - being British and looking at many of my past podcast descriptions, I feel the need to apologise for it’s lateness - Its something to do with British people that’s for sure, I was walking up the stairs at work yesterday and as I passed someone on the stairs they apologised to me. Unless they know something I don’t, I am finding it more and more strange! Maybe I am fatter than I think!Soooooo, thats a ramble done. Tunes! Starting at 129BPM and winding up to 142BPM, I have recorded a 124 minute 25 track mega mix for you! It starts progressive and journeys through the scales of Trance all the way to a rather oldskool almost DJ Isaac-esque sounding hard trancer at the end from Indecent Noise. It was an auditory treat to mix for you guys - This is ‘The Speed Of Dark’, I hope you enjoy it! xXx1) Dave Walker - Mango (Original Mix)2) Max Gueli - Xperience (Original Mix)3) Andrew Lang - Presence Of Mind (Original Mix)4) Alter Future - Good Morning (Original Mix)5) Arkham Knights - Disconnected (Original Mix)6) Craig Meichan - Vesta (2nd Phase Remix)7) Meyce & Steve Nyman - Rebirth (Original Mix)8) RAM - Clockwork Orange (Original Mix)9) Orkidea - Liberation (Mystery Islands Remix)10) Bariuz & Exosun - Akinya (Original Mix)11) The Thrillseekers - Find You (Ferry Tayle Remix)12) Solarstone - Purity (Peetu S Remix)13) Johan Gielen - Physical Overdrive (Peetu S Remix)14) Dogzilla - Without You (John O’Callaghan Remix)15) Metronome - Rainfall (Symphonix Remix)16) TAU - Mahayana (2015 Rework)17) Ghost Rider - Turn Around (Original Mix)18) Jordan Suckley - Vermin (Original Mix)19) Mark Sherry & Dr Willis - Here Come The Drums (Sean Tyas Remix)20) James Dymond - Samples Of Silk (Original Mix)21) Eddie Bitar - Chemical Spill (Original Mix)22) Aimoon - Mental Universe (Original Mix)23) Cristian Ketelaars - No Rush (Original Mix)24) Jordan Suckley - Contaminated (Sam Jones Remix)25) Indecent Noise - Cerebrus (Original Mix)

Unless they know something I don't, I am finding it more and more strange! Maybe I am fatter than I think!Soooooo, thats a ramble done. Tunes! Starting at 129BPM and winding up to 142BPM, I have recorded a 124 minute 25 track mega mix for you! item.title: FranetiC - Philae - Episode 110 [ Trance | Uplifting | Psy | Tech ]
item.dc:creator: franetic
item.description:
Well hello….

A journey including plenty of freshened reworks of some older tracks. Travelling all the way from 130bpm to 141bpm. Sounds on the progressive side all the way through to uplifting bangers, a spattering of Psy and finishing on a smidgen of Tech Trance.

Enjoy xXx

1) Solid Stone & Jennifer Rene - Not Enough (Original Mix) 2) Paul Oakenfold & Cassandra - Touch Me (Mike Koglin 2.0 Remix) 3) Skykeeper & Holbrook - Daylight (Original Mix) 4) Alex Di Stefano - Escape From The Past (Original Mix) 5) Kris Morten - Ignition (Original Mix) 6) Gary Maguire - Dont Believe The Hype (iNside Intro Version) 7) Onova - Platitude (Allen Watts Remix) 8) Dutch Force - Deadline (Kinetica Remix) 9) UCast - LAX (Original Mix) 10) Talla 2XLC - In Silence (Offi [...]
item.content:encoded:
Well hello….

A journey including plenty of freshened reworks of some older tracks. Travelling all the way from 130bpm to 141bpm. Sounds on the progressive side all the way through to uplifting bangers, a spattering of Psy and finishing on a smidgen of Tech Trance.

Enjoy xXx

1) Solid Stone & Jennifer Rene - Not Enough (Original Mix) 2) Paul Oakenfold & Cassandra - Touch Me (Mike Koglin 2.0 Remix) 3) Skykeeper & Holbrook - Daylight (Original Mix) 4) Alex Di Stefano - Escape From The Past (Original Mix) 5) Kris Morten - Ignition (Original Mix) 6) Gary Maguire - Dont Believe The Hype (iNside Intro Version) 7) Onova - Platitude (Allen Watts Remix) 8) Dutch Force - Deadline (Kinetica Remix) 9) UCast - LAX (Original Mix) 10) Talla 2XLC - In Silence (Official Trancefusion The Legends Theme) 11) Sied Van Riel & Standerwick - In A Perfect World (Solarstone Pure Remix) 12) Orkidea - Purity (Sneijder Remix) 13) Paul Denton - Flick The Switch (Original Mix)

item.title: FranetiC - UNDERGROUND: A HISTORY OF TRANCE [ Late 90’s + Early 00’s Classic Trance + Hard Trance ]
item.dc:creator: franetic
item.description:
A journey through the underground classics of Trance & Hard Trance. Uplifting through to the dark and dirty, 105 mins of pure classics to wrap your lobes around.

A chronicle including some of my all time favourite tunes from (here comes the cliche!) back in the day out clubbing. Dance Academy in Plymouth plus Monastery and Claires in Torquay, all now indeed long gone…. Great great times….

Enjoy xXx

1) Cygnus X - The Orange Theme (Original Mix) 2) The Mystery - The Forgiven (Original Mix) 3) The Thrillseekers - Dreaming Of You (Flutlicht Remix) 4) CRW - Like A Cat - Feat. item.title: FranetiC - Trance In Your Pants - Episode 108 [ Tough Progressive | Uplifting | Tech Trance ]
item.dc:creator: franetic
item.description:
Beat those mid week blues and enjoy some Trance in your pants!

A journey through Trance from 133bpm to 144bpm - Some real uplifting loveliness in here, working up to some hole digging stompers at the end.

Enjoy xXx

item.title: FranetiC - Paradox - Episode 107 [ Breaks | Uplifting | Psy | Tech Trance ]
item.dc:creator: franetic
item.description:
Enrico Fermi once asked ”Where is everybody?” So the the idea of the Fermi Paradox was born…. Well I have a theory; they [the elusive other worldly civilizations] are obviously all busy raving in their own Dyson spheres, without a care in the cosmos for what else exists - designers of their own personal infinite universe.

Well, here is a piece of my little universe all for you. A journey from Breaks, to Uplifting to Psy and beyond….

Happy Sunday to all, I hope you are STILL having an epic weekend!

xXx

1) Funk You - Dance 2 The Rhythm (Original Mix) 2) Art Of Trance - Madagascar (Richard Durand Remix) 3) Will Atkinson - Victims (Original Mix) 4) Federation - Be There (Darren Porter Remix) 5) Morten Granau - Polynomial (Ranji Remix) 6) Phaxe - Disturbed (Original Mix) 7) Replay - Another World (Original Mix) 8) Luca De Maas - The [...]

item.title: Hiram’s Highway. Vol 1 [ Chilled | Electronica | Progressive | House ]
item.dc:creator: franetic
item.description:
I have returned, after a pretty life changing break away it has to be said. I have been working hard on my career and I have missed being able to have the time to escape to do this stuff.

I wanted to start my return to podcasting with a new project I am going to undertake. Something which includes styles of music I find myself listening to more and more. This project is ‘Hiram’s Highway’. Focusing more on electronica, chilled vibes more designed to bring you down to a comforting pillow than send you sky high.

FranetiC will be back with another instalment of all things full of Trancey soon, in the meantime - enjoy….

In to the deep. A feast of chilled electronic goodness…

1] Talul - Arythmika - Original Mix 2] Jon Hopkins - Abandon Window - Moderat Remix 3] N’to - The Sand Dealer 4] Henry Krinkle - Stay - Just [...]

item.title: FranetiC - Sunkissed Twisted Bliss - Episode 2 RE-RELEASE
item.dc:creator: franetic
item.description:
A delve in the archives here, so for the first time going a little off sequence, but this was removed about 3 years ago from podomatic and I wanted to re-instate it for a while as its got some AMAZING classic trance on, that was lost until now!

This was probably my 3rd or 4th ever mix I recorded, so apologies for the ropey mixing lol!

No idea on track-listing Im afraid, that is most definitely long gone, so surprise mix for you…. If you weren’t there for when I started this podcast back in 2010!!

4 years…. Zoomed by!

Enjoy

xXx

Enjoy xXx

1) Estiva - Dinodrums (Original Mix) 2) Tonerush - Comet (Original Mix) 3) Sean Tyas & RAM - Beat Boutique (Original Mix) 4) Funabashi - The Legacy (Stoneface & Terminal Remix) 5) Matthew Dunne - Splint (Original Mix) 6) Binary Finary - 1998 (James Dymond Remix) 7) Will Atkinson - Deep Impact (Original Mix) 8) Audiomatic & Phaxe - Pineapple X-Press (Original Mix) 9) Day Din - Breaking Dread (Original Mix) 10) Bowdidge & Taylor - Sidewinder (Original Mix) 11) Alex Wackii - Marianne (Original Mix)

item.title: Rhys Thomas - August 2013 Guest Mix - Episode 98 [ Psy | Uplifting | Tech Trance ]
item.dc:creator: franetic
item.description:
This week a very special guest who regularly graces the decks for Escape in Swansea. Me this Rhys and his girlfriend Louise in Ibiza last year, normally in space cadet mode for breakfast at our hotel…. Awesome guys! Rhys is a Trance head through and through, with a more aggressive peak time sound fusing Psy, Uplifting and tech Trance…. An awesome mix for you to wrap your lobes around… xXx

item.title: Louk - July 2013 Guest Mix - Episode 97 [ Classics Trance, Tech trance & Hard Trance ]
item.dc:creator: franetic
item.description: Very special 2 HOUR classics guest mix this week from an all time legend in the underground dance scene, really privileged to have this mix, its beyond a banger! Some amazing tunes in this…….. Louk - Back In The Days (Guestmix for Franetic) Franetic asked me to do this classics mix, and as her show is quite trance orientated I thought I’d pick out quite a few uplifting tracks I don’t normally play that often in harder sets compared to some other classics you’ve all heard me hammer but I absolutely love them and thought i’d dig them out. These were mental tracks that shaped the music that I listen to and make now and it’s definitely fair to say the late 90’s and early 00’s were some of the best music out there. Humate - Love Stimula [...]
item.content:encoded: Very special 2 HOUR classics guest mix this week from an all time legend in the underground dance scene, really privileged to have this mix, its beyond a banger! Some amazing tunes in this…….. Louk - Back In The Days (Guestmix for Franetic) Franetic asked me to do this classics mix, and as her show is quite trance orientated I thought I’d pick out quite a few uplifting tracks I don’t normally play that often in harder sets compared to some other classics you’ve all heard me hammer but I absolutely love them and thought i’d dig them out. These were mental tracks that shaped the music that I listen to and make now and it’s definitely fair to say the late 90’s and early 00’s were some of the best music out there. Humate - Love Stimulation (Blank + Jones Mix) [Deviant]Novalis - The Therapy [Future]Nordlander - Starchild [Omni]Kay Cee - Escape [Additive]DJ Tiesto - Sparkles (Transa Mix) [Nebula]Alpha Breed - Beyond The Moon [Deal]O40 Vs DJ Hein - Spectrum Energize [Steady Beat]Olive Inc - Contact (Sean Dexter Mix) [Suck Me Plasma]Future State - Now Is The Time [Radar]Parker + Clind - Teleportation [Bonzai]K90 - Deliverance [Telica]Body Shock - Full Moon [Bonzai]DJ Tom Stevens vs Koma Squad - Outface 2000 (Lac Terra Mix) [Go For It]Pro-Active vs Spaze@tta - Cosmic Space (Club Mix) [Suck Me Plasma]Megamind - Taub [BXR]Checkmate - Another World [Fog Area]Foxx - Move That Body (Scot Project Mix) [Modem]Impegement Syndrom - Lowdown [Tunnel] Mikado - Feel The Bass (DJ Wag Mix) [Propeller]DJ Mill + Manuel T - Destiny [UFO]Pacific Link - Planetary Collapse [Red Alert]Unknown - Angel 001 [White]David Craig - Lord Of The Universe [Eve]Human Force - Odyssey 3000 (Junk Project Mix) [Drizzly]Airwave - Above The Sky [Bonzai]Junk Project - Beats Bring Silence [Universal Prime Breaks]

item.title: FranetiC - The Return - Episode 95 [ Tough Progressive | Uplifting | Psy | Tech Trance ]
item.dc:creator: franetic
item.description: Finally back with a 2 hour (ish) long special mix apologies for the huge delay, I have been finishing off university and hunting for a new job! Podcasts will be more regular from this point onward.I decided to do an extended mix so as to make up for the mixes I havent been able to put out, and also because of the catch up I had to do on all the amazing new Trance doing the rounds atm! Chucked a few classics in there for good measure. A journey through the whole spectrum of Trance music. Absolutely loving Rank 1 remix of ‘Under The Gun’, Leigh Nash’s voice is simply stunning, also featuring the Club Mix of my collaboration track ‘Drift’, Dart Rayne & Yura Moonlight also [...]
item.content:encoded: Finally back with a 2 hour (ish) long special mix apologies for the huge delay, I have been finishing off university and hunting for a new job! Podcasts will be more regular from this point onward.I decided to do an extended mix so as to make up for the mixes I havent been able to put out, and also because of the catch up I had to do on all the amazing new Trance doing the rounds atm! Chucked a few classics in there for good measure. A journey through the whole spectrum of Trance music. Absolutely loving Rank 1 remix of ‘Under The Gun’, Leigh Nash’s voice is simply stunning, also featuring the Club Mix of my collaboration track ‘Drift’, Dart Rayne & Yura Moonlight also featuring twice on this mix with two wicked releases ‘Helix’ and ‘Liberation’.
item.itunes:subtitle: Finally back with a 2 hour (ish) ;) long special mix :) apologies for the huge delay, I have been finishing off university and hunting ...
item.itunes:summary: Finally back with a 2 hour (ish) ;) long special mix :) apologies for the huge delay, I have been finishing off university and hunting for a new job! Podcasts will be more regular from this point onward.I decided to do an extended mix so as to make up for the mixes I havent been able to put out, and also because of the catch up I had to do on all the amazing new Trance doing the rounds atm! Chucked a few classics in there for good measure. A journey through the whole spectrum of Trance music. Absolutely loving Rank 1 remix of 'Under The Gun', Leigh Nash's voice is simply stunning, also featuring the Club Mix of my collaboration track 'Drift', Dart Rayne Yura Moonlight also featuring twice on this mix with two wicked releases 'Helix' and 'Liberation'. :)
item.itunes:author: Franetic

item.title: Tom Costelloe - May 2013 guest mix - Episode 93 [ Progressive | Tough | Uplifting Trance ]
item.dc:creator: franetic
item.description:
This is the month of May, summer is hinting at its arrival and something to accompany this most lovely time of year is a very sun kissed and blissful mix from the legend that is Tom Costelloe…. A local hero to Devon hailing from London originally Tom has had his fair share of DJ globe trotting adventures and residencies. So honoured to have one of my DJ heros from over the years to feature in this guest mix.

item.content:encoded:
This is the month of May, summer is hinting at its arrival and something to accompany this most lovely time of year is a very sun kissed and blissful mix from the legend that is Tom Costelloe…. A local hero to Devon hailing from London originally Tom has had his fair share of DJ globe trotting adventures and residencies. So honoured to have one of my DJ heros from over the years to feature in this guest mix.

Bio…..

With a true passion for music alongside a well-developed taste in all genres, an energising stage presence and the ability to read perfectly his audience, its common knowledge that TOM COSTELLOE has got the art of DJ’ing to a standard that’s hard to beat…

He started DJ’ing in 1987, playing out at local pubs and clubs, and doing Weddings, Birthdays ETC. His natural talent was soon spotted and in 1991 he was offered a weekly residency at FUTURES a House club in Deptford (London). Futures soon outgrew its venue and Tom linked up with Bernie Sinclair & Sean McClusky of LOVE RANCH who began the now infamous CLUB UK and Tom became resident of these events from 1992…

In the Summer of 1995 Tom was asked to become resident for LOVE RANCH at SPACE (Ibiza) on Thursday Mornings. Tom impressed several promoters on the island and was approached to play the legendary SPACE on Sunday mornings supporting the likes of Brandon Block and Alex P, and proved his versatility with set’s both inside and on the terrace. Whilst in Ibiza Tom Also played for SIGN OF THE TIMES, at many of the SUNRISE parties and at CAFÉ MAMBO and was also headlining at many of the smaller San Antonio clubs.

Back in the UK Tom Continued to Play for SIGN OF THE TIMES as the main resident, this time based in London at THE ROCKET. And 1998 saw further visits to Ibiza where Tom played for SUNNY SIDE UP at ES PARIDIS, CLOCKWORK ORANGE, and the now infamous GODSKITCHEN at AMNESIA where he made 6 appearances as a resident which continued the following year.

In 2000 Tom relocated to Devon as resident and promoter of EYECON at the DANCE ACADEMY, PLYMOUTH - playing alongside some of the world’s most talented and most wanted DJ’S, booking the artist’s for this event and putting his unique slant on the line up’s - you could never say it was all about one style, more like a mish mash of several! And that’s the way TOM liked it!

This popular Saturday night event boasted a weekly attendance of 1200+ and an ever-growing group of dedicated followers that crammed the cavernous club almost full to capacity every week, all waiting for the time when TOM hit the decks with his weekly assault of upfront and classic tunes – basically

YOU knew when TOM COSTELLOE was on!!!

EYECON @ the Dance Academy was voted club of the year (regional) in MIXMAG in 2004 and received several similar accolades in music publications such as DJ mag, Muzik and Ministry Magazines.

Tom, accompanied by MANOCH BAHMANZADEH (owner) both turned the DANCE ACADEMY in Plymouth into one of the most respected and much loved events in the UK, and it’s sad loss still continues to this day…

Tracklisting….

1) Chris Malinchak - So Good To Me (Original Mix) 2) Sia - Breathe (Arty Bootleg) 3) Gabriel & Dresden Feat. Molly - Let Go (Blake Jarrell Remix) 4) Cazzette - Weapon (Vicetone Remix) 5) Sander Van Doorn & Mark Knight Vs Underworld - Ten 6) First State Feat. Sarah Howells - Seeing Stars (Original Mix) 7) Norin Rad - Aldo (Original Mix) 8) Arty feat. Chris James - Together We Are (Audien Remix) 9) Doctor P feat. Eva Simons - Bulletproof (Vicetone Remix) 10) Zedd Feat. Foxes - Clarity (Ftampa Remix) 11) Kyau & Albert Vs Daft Punk - Be there 4 U One More Time (Above & Beyond Bootleg) 12) Paul Oakenfold - Southern Sun (Paul Thomas Remix)

Enjoy xXx

This is Energize, episode 87! Sorry for the huge-a-manormous delay, currently working hard at uni….. Well, trying too! Got some awesome tuneage for you this week, including one track by Nick The Kid, Digital Self & Tektonic present The Nameless Girl; first heard in Ibiza 2012, ‘Bright Light’ is finally released out on Fenology!! Get your copy http://www.trackitdown.net/track/nick-the-kid-presents-the-nameless-girl/bright-light-the-remixes-bundle/trance/5408768.html Kicking proceedings off with John O’Callaghan and Full Tilts latest track ‘Breathe’ tiz truly lushous! A mix from proggy to uplifting to techy! Enjoy!

xXx

item.content:encoded:
This is Energize, episode 87! Sorry for the huge-a-manormous delay, currently working hard at uni….. Well, trying too! Got some awesome tuneage for you this week, including one track by Nick The Kid, Digital Self & Tektonic present The Nameless Girl; first heard in Ibiza 2012, ‘Bright Light’ is finally released out on Fenology!! Get your copy http://www.trackitdown.net/track/nick-the-kid-presents-the-nameless-girl/bright-light-the-remixes-bundle/trance/5408768.html Kicking proceedings off with John O’Callaghan and Full Tilts latest track ‘Breathe’ tiz truly lushous! A mix from proggy to uplifting to techy! Enjoy!

xXx

1) John O’Callaghan & Full Tilt Feat. Karen Kelly - Breathe (Original Mix) 2) Emma Hewitt - Rewind (Mikkas Remix) 3) Nick The Kid, Digital Self & Tektonic Present. The Nameless Girl - Bright Light (Digital Self & Tektonic Mix) 4) Store & Forward - Bananas (Original Mix) 5) Isaac Swess - Supremacy (Original Mix) 6) Ricardo Van Valker - LV4-26 (Flavio Grifo Remix) 7) Tegma - The Gods (Original Mix) 8) QBass - Black Milk (Original Mix) 9) Armin Van Buuren - Communication (James Dymond Remix) 10) Bart Claessen - Playmo (Original Mix) 11) Joey V & Johann Stone - Moondancer (Johaan Stone Mix)

item.title: Jennarate - December Guest Mix - Episode 82 [ UK Hard Dance / Hard Trance ]
item.dc:creator: franetic
item.description:
December guest mix brought to you by Jennarate, a high energy mix of UK Hard Trance & Hard Dance…. Enjoy xXx

Jennarate likes it harder then your Gran bouncing on a deflated space hopper - mixing and producing euphoric, driving, upfront Hard Dance.

Now having performed for major club nights within the UK and Ibiza, the future looks bright purple as Jennarate continues to grow a loyal and dedicated following that any renowned DJ would be proud to boast.

“Pulsating DJ sets full of energetic high octane beats. Jennarate is destined for the top!” – Scott Attrill, Riot!

Track listing to follow, she is out of the country, just being great….

I shall return in 2013 with a 2 hour special Trance mix…. Until then Merry Christmas and Hap [...]

item.description:
This is Guiding Light, a mix blissful tunes all the way from Progressive to Tech. A journey from 130bpm up to 142bpm. Some awesome remixes of some classic UK Hard Dance in this weeks mix, all firmly sitting perfectly within the world of Trance. Works up to some spine tingling trance in the middle …… Look out for Astrix - Vicious Cycles…. A spot of Psy Trance that I heard played out at Godskitchen - Clash Of The Gods, this is 100% in my top ten tracks for the year, it is simply PHAT! Enjoy xXx

item.title: RAZE - November 2012 Guest mix - Episode 78
item.dc:creator: franetic
item.description:
A techy feast to sink your ears in to for this months guest mix, presenting RAZE (Neil Castle) he has graced the decks at many events across the South West UK for years, his mix is proof of this guys skill in tune selection and mixing….. Enjoy! xXx

DJ Raze debuted in the South West in 1993, a few months on from when he first ever touched a pair of record decks. The Plymouth Warehouse proved to be of a huge influence with Raze diligently collecting the records he had heard every week from the big names he saw. This passion and enthusiasm lead to a set playing for Speed Promotions alongside Slipmatt, and a chance encounter following this meant he also span an impromptu set at the legendary Plymouth Pavilions for long standing rave promoters ‘Obsessed’ From Hardcore, as the years went on, the progression into Trance followed, and Raze landed a set at [...]
item.content:encoded:
A techy feast to sink your ears in to for this months guest mix, presenting RAZE (Neil Castle) he has graced the decks at many events across the South West UK for years, his mix is proof of this guys skill in tune selection and mixing….. Enjoy! xXx

DJ Raze debuted in the South West in 1993, a few months on from when he first ever touched a pair of record decks. The Plymouth Warehouse proved to be of a huge influence with Raze diligently collecting the records he had heard every week from the big names he saw. This passion and enthusiasm lead to a set playing for Speed Promotions alongside Slipmatt, and a chance encounter following this meant he also span an impromptu set at the legendary Plymouth Pavilions for long standing rave promoters ‘Obsessed’ From Hardcore, as the years went on, the progression into Trance followed, and Raze landed a set at ‘Bossanova’ (Sound Factory) and continued to play for some years before taking a short break to raise his family. Now to the present, and the mixing bug has been caught again, with Raze holding residencies for TranceFormNation (Exeter) and Liquid Pulse (Plymouth), where he has performed alongside Mark EG, M-Zone, Signum, Joey Riot, Nick The Kid, Kidd Kaos, Tek-Tonic and many more.

Tracklisting:

1) Mooniac - Jelly (Original Mix) 2) Ashley Wallbridge - Arrival (Ashley Wallbridge Extended Mix) 3) Eric Strong - Orchids (Original Mix) 4) Funkagenda & Alex K - Drift (Original Mix) 5) System F & Cosmic Gate - The Blue Theme (FerryMix) 2009 - Life’s Too Short (Alexx Rave Mix) 6) Metaphor -Dyro (Original Mix) 7) Hard Rock Sofa/Swanky Tunes - Here We Go (Original Mix) 8) Marcel Woods & W&W - Trigger (Original Mix) 9) Tiësto & Showtek - Hell Yeah! (Original Mix) 10) Delerium Feat Sarah Mclachlan - Silence (Tiësto Remix W&W Vs Jonas Stenberg Mix)
item.itunes:subtitle: A techy feast to sink your ears in to for this months guest mix, presenting RAZE (Neil Castle) he has graced the decks at many ...
item.itunes:summary:
A techy feast to sink your ears in to for this months guest mix, presenting RAZE (Neil Castle) he has graced the decks at many events across the South West UK for years, his mix is proof of this guys skill in tune selection and mixing..... Enjoy! xXx
DJ Raze debuted in the South West in 1993, a few months on from when he first ever touched a pair of record decks. The Plymouth Warehouse proved to be of a huge influence with Raze diligently collecting the records he had heard every week from the big names he saw. This passion and enthusiasm lead to a set playing for Speed Promotions alongside Slipmatt, and a chance encounter following this meant he also span an impromptu set at the legendary Plymouth Pavilions for long standing rave promoters 'Obsessed' From Hardcore, as the years went on, the progression into Trance followed, and Raze landed a set at 'Bossanova' (Sound Factory) and continued to play for some years before taking a short break to raise his family. Now to the present, and the mixing bug has been caught again, with Raze holding residencies for TranceFormNation (Exeter) and Liquid Pulse (Plymouth), where he has performed alongside Mark EG, M-Zone, Signum, Joey Riot, Nick The Kid, Kidd Kaos, Tek-Tonic and many more.
Tracklisting:
1) Mooniac - Jelly (Original Mix) 2) Ashley Wallbridge - Arrival (Ashley Wallbridge Extended Mix) 3) Eric Strong - Orchids (Original Mix) 4) Funkagenda Alex K - Drift (Original Mix) 5) System F Cosmic Gate - The Blue Theme (FerryMix) 2009 - Life's Too Short (Alexx Rave Mix) 6) Metaphor -Dyro (Original Mix) 7) Hard Rock Sofa/Swanky Tunes - Here We Go (Original Mix) 8) Marcel Woods WW - Trigger (Original Mix) 9) Tiësto Showtek - Hell Yeah! (Original Mix) 10) Delerium Feat Sarah Mclachlan - Silence (Tiësto Remix WW Vs Jonas Stenberg Mix)

Apologies for the extended break fellow Trance heads…. I have started back at university and it just so happens to be my 3rd and final year, so things have gotten a little serious my end! Fear not I will be posting mixes as and when possible, atleast twice a month from now Back this time with a fresh collection of tunes journeying from 130bpm to 140bpm, Progressive/Tough and Uplifting trance, including a collaboration from Digital Self and Tektonic and myself! It goes by the name of ‘Drift’ and is a techy driven uplifting monster Hope you like!

Enjoy! xXx

item.dc:creator: franetic
item.description:
What a truly epic summer break that was! Ibiza was unreal and indescribably good! The most amazing time I think I can safely say was had by all! Albiet most of us slightly broken!! lol! Tektonic and I had the chance to play in Room 2 at ASOT in Ibiza this summer, it was unbelievably scary and fun all at once! This is mine and Tektonic’s set recorded from ASOT @ Privilege Ibiza 2012! item.dc:creator: franetic
item.description:
This is episode 72, a studio recorded version of a set I performed out live at Tidy Boys @ Kools Night Club in Teignmouth on the 17th August 2012. A harder offering from me this week, with some beasty Tech Trance to begin with winding in to some awesome UK Hard Trance, varying from the new to the old, its a fusion of the classic and the upfront. Enjoy xXx

item.content:encoded:
Well hello, apologies for the delay in uploading this latest episode, I ran out of bandwidth and Podomatic wouldn’t allow me to upload another episode until today BOOO! This is episode 71, well and truly back in the realms of House and Trance inspired by the White Isle that is Ibiza…. T-minus 2 and half weeks until I depart for the island with some of the closest friends and general mental cases anyone could ever wish for! I shall be DJing for Hindsight Island of Trance week, at various clubs and bars across the island. I am actually away for 4 weeks travelling in which I leave you in the hands of Jennarate and Hyped Live aswell as Digital Self and Tektonic all guest hosting for the whole month of September. Some beautiful tracks for you to wrap your listening glands around, blissful to uplifting to techy, including some the tracks I intend on smashing out whilst in Ibiza!

Enjoy xXx

1) Mark Knight Feat. Skin - Nothing Matters (Tensake Remix) 2) Ivan Gough, Feenixpawl & Georgie Kay - In My Mind (Walden Remix) 3) ANDAIN - Turn Up The Sound (Gabriel & Dresden Remix) 4) Denis Sheperd & Cold Blue Feat. Ana Criado - Fallen Angel (Digital Self & Tektonic Remix) 5) Airscape - Sosei (Taito 2012 Mix) 6) Above and Beyon Vs Andy Moor - Air For Life (Norin & Rad Remix) 7) Matt Davey Feat Lo-Fi Sugar - Higher Ground (Karanda Remix) 8) DNS Project - 2Day (Original Mix) 9) Thomas Gold, Chris Ortega & Nicole Tyler - Hypnotized (Peter Brown 2012 Edit) 10) Maximized - (Original Mix) 11) Iversoon & Alex Daf - Vita (Bilal El Aly Remix) 12) William James - Fuse (Original Mix) 13) Porter & Weston - The Tesla Effect (Original Mix)

item.title: Jake Nicholls Live @ Cue Play - August 2012 Guest Mix - Episode 70 [ Tech | Acid | Hard Trance ]
item.dc:creator: franetic
item.description:
This months guest mix comes from a legend in the UK Hard Trance scene, this northern maestro never fails to tear everyones ear drums to shreds when rocking the decks! This set was recorded live at CUEPLAY in Leeds back in April of this year. A long over due style of music on this podcast, this mix takes you on a journey in to the darker styles of Trance…. Some downright dangerous classics and wicked own productions of Mr Jake Nicholls….. Currently awaiting the beginning Island of Trance in Ibiza this coming Septemeber where he and I will hopefully have the odd back to back set to look forwards too…..

Enjoy xXx

1) Intro / X Arnej 2) Out Of The Past - Mystery (Hard Mix) 3) Jake Nicholls - Grooveline - Original - Joyride 4) Jake Nicholls - Zeitgeist - Origi [...]
item.content:encoded:
This months guest mix comes from a legend in the UK Hard Trance scene, this northern maestro never fails to tear everyones ear drums to shreds when rocking the decks! This set was recorded live at CUEPLAY in Leeds back in April of this year. A long over due style of music on this podcast, this mix takes you on a journey in to the darker styles of Trance…. Some downright dangerous classics and wicked own productions of Mr Jake Nicholls….. Currently awaiting the beginning Island of Trance in Ibiza this coming Septemeber where he and I will hopefully have the odd back to back set to look forwards too…..

Enjoy xXx

1) Intro / X Arnej 2) Out Of The Past - Mystery (Hard Mix) 3) Jake Nicholls - Grooveline - Original - Joyride 4) Jake Nicholls - Zeitgeist - Original - Digitally Infected 5) K Blank - Strangetune - Joyride 6) Atlantic Wave - Reinforced - Giada Remix 7) Kai Tracid - Voyager 8) Dark sector - Feel it 9) Sunbeam Outside World - Jake Nicholls Remix 10) Jake Nicholls - Psychonaut Express 11) Jake Nicholls - Reverie 12) Josh Lang Tektic 14) Ultraviolence & Hardforze — Into My Eyes [Kuruption Remix) 15) Dean Zone & The Sixth Sense - Acid Moonlight (Original Club Mix)

item.title: FranetiC - Cadence - Episode 68 [ Progressive | Uplifting | Electro | Tech Trance ]
item.dc:creator: franetic
item.description: Hallo episode 68…. Cadence…. A thoroughly complete mix covering all the Trance rocking my world this week! Featuring the old time Trance legend that is Mr Paul Van Dyk and his collaboration with the spring chicken of the Trance world that is Arty ‘The Ocean’, lovely little vocal track on offer that really does show off the fusion of the 2 differing sounds that these guys produce…. Utterly in Love with Andy Moors new offering featuring Jessica Sweetman with a track called ‘In Your Arms’… Also Ben Golds remix of River of hearts as always delivering a trance monster pre packaged and ready to go for the White Isle this September…. He will be with me on The Island of Trance week!! Loving Onovas - Platitude, released in 2010, it truly is an uplifting moster! Lush!!!
item.content:encoded:

item.title: July Guest Mix - Nick King - Episode 67 [ Trance ]
item.dc:creator: franetic
item.description:
Awesome uplifting guest mix for you this week, coming from Scotland, introducing Nick King….. Nick King is a Glasgow based DJ, he started his musical journey at the tender age of 13 when first listening to an old tape of his father from the famous 90s rave Fantazia. He the progressed into old school rave and house music going to as many events as possible. At the age of 15 he bought a second hand pair of old vinyl decks and that’s were it all begun! His passion for music he says runs through his blood! He has played in one of Glasgow’s west end most prestiges clubs and is now starting on his production career with his first single coming soon. Only being 23 and having an understanding of music like pro he is one to listen out for! Enjoy xXx

1.Moorea Blur - U Feel This (2trancY Big Room Remix) 2.Estiva feat Josie - Better Days (Norin & Rad Remix) [...]

item.dc:creator: franetic
item.description: This is secret summer, named after something which we in the UK are currently enduring… Winter has decided it wants to carry on this year, so giving us here a ‘Secret Summer’….. Can you tell I am beginning to run out of names yet for the podcasts? Anyways…. To the music…. All the best in Trance music, rocking my world this week! Very cool remix of a 90’s classic BT - Flaming June, although corresponding ironically to the name of the podcast, it is most certainly not a Flaming June here in Blighty! Some cool promos received in my inbox recently in the form of Lee + Slater with their tune ‘Ripper’ Oozing with White Isle Balearic vibes and well as Ionstorm with ‘Skyburn’ an uplifting fast pacer, winding you up to finish on som [...]
item.content:encoded:
This is secret summer, named after something which we in the UK are currently enduring… Winter has decided it wants to carry on this year, so giving us here a ‘Secret Summer’….. Can you tell I am beginning to run out of names yet for the podcasts? Anyways…. To the music…. All the best in Trance music, rocking my world this week! Very cool remix of a 90’s classic BT - Flaming June, although corresponding ironically to the name of the podcast, it is most certainly not a Flaming June here in Blighty! Some cool promos received in my inbox recently in the form of Lee + Slater with their tune ‘Ripper’ Oozing with White Isle Balearic vibes and well as Ionstorm with ‘Skyburn’ an uplifting fast pacer, winding you up to finish on some Tech Trance….. Enjoy ma beauty’s! xXx

1) M.E.M - Next Level (Original Mix) 2) Armin Van Buuren Feat. Ana Criado - Suddenly Summer (Heatbeat Remix) 3) BT - Flaming June (Laptop Symphony Rework) 4) Andy Richmond - The Only One (William James Remix) 5) Lange Vs Gareth Emery - This Is All Out (Heatbeat Vs Andy Moor Remix) Lange Mashup 6) C-Systems & Bushi Feat. Hanna Finsen - Dreams Will Never End (Dub Mix) 7) Lee + Slater - Ripper (Original Mix) 8) Craig Bradley Feat. Lucy Clarke - One Life (Original Instrumental Mix) 9) Ionstorm - Skyburn (Extended Mix) 10) Gordon Coutts - 1.21GW (Original Mix) 11) Bryan Kearney & Jamie Walker - Nataraja (Original Mix)

item.title: Luke & Joel Heaton - June Guest Mix - Episode 63 [ Uplifting | Tech | Trance ]
item.dc:creator: franetic
item.description:
Its guest mix time again, and may I present to you some local legends to me brothers and duo Luke and Joel Heaton. A truly epic trance mix for you this week from these two. Shall be gracing the white isle with both of them for the Hindsight Pres. Island Of Trance week in Ibiza this coming Sept so if you are there between 9th to 16th sept keep your eyes peeled for us.

Im taking a break for 2 weeks, so you shall be hearing back from me in mid June! Until then I leave you in the hands of these talented guys! xXx

Luke and Joel Heaton bio…..

In 2001 at the tender age of 14 these two boys were introduced to the hard dance scene thanks to listening to Mark EG and M Zone tapes passed down from older friends and siblings, this was the start of their musical ambition whi [...]
item.content:encoded:
Its guest mix time again, and may I present to you some local legends to me brothers and duo Luke and Joel Heaton. A truly epic trance mix for you this week from these two. Shall be gracing the white isle with both of them for the Hindsight Pres. Island Of Trance week in Ibiza this coming Sept so if you are there between 9th to 16th sept keep your eyes peeled for us.

Im taking a break for 2 weeks, so you shall be hearing back from me in mid June! Until then I leave you in the hands of these talented guys! xXx

Luke and Joel Heaton bio…..

In 2001 at the tender age of 14 these two boys were introduced to the hard dance scene thanks to listening to Mark EG and M Zone tapes passed down from older friends and siblings, this was the start of their musical ambition which has progressed massively over the years.

Although both underage Luke and Joel started to attend dance events such as Slinky when they were just 16, this then progressed to bigger nights out and to a wider selection of different dance music genres up and down the country, as their love and passion for the music grew so did their interest in mixing.

The main musical focal points in the Luke and Joels sets are Trance and Hardtrance; however their abilitys to be able play almost anything has also seen them rock dance floors with House, Hardstyle and European Hardcore, this is something they feel is necessary these days as it opens more doors and allows them to play more freely.

In 2010 dreams became reality when the boys were asked by Nick the Kid to play in Ibiza for Hindsight, this saw them playing in some major clubs, one of them being the mighty Eden, where they played for Judgement Sundays alongside a star studded line up of DJs they could only dream of. As well as playing for other huge nights such as Tidy in Ibiza, they have also rocked pool parties and various other clubs and bars on the White Isle and gained themselves a fan base of people. They have since been back twice to play in Ibiza, this includes Hindsight’s massive September 2011 trip – An Island of Trance. Luke and Joel are thrilled to have been asked to return to Ibiza in 2012, In June and September which will see them play at some of the worlds biggest clubs and alongside some of the worlds biggest DJs yet again.

The duo’s ambitions don’t stop at mixing, however, they have also been working extremely hard on the production side of music. In 2011 they visited the Organ Donors studio and produced a track with them which has been released on Implosion Digital, they have also spent time with other local producers, having a more hands on approach and learning different styles which they hope will open up new ideas and visions to the pair until they are satisfied with creating that sound and feel they both love.

With Future sounds hosting a range of nights, and them both starting to become regular faces for Hindsight, not forgetting to mention the pairs return to Ibiza in June and September as well as many more other events to be playing for this year, the pair have come a long way from that first set in an empty room. They continue to work hard at what they love and push themselves in their mixing and producing, 2012 is set to be yet another amazing year for the Heatons!

Luke and Joels Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Luke-and-Joel-Heaton/251551374915124

Tracklisting:

1. Digital Self and Tek-Tonic - Origin 2. Ben Gold and Tritonal - Apex 3. Sander Van Doorn - Chasin 4. Scot Project - G 5. Cosmic Gate - Back to Earth - Arty Rmx 6. Marlo - Megalodon 7. Cosmic gate feat. Jes - Flying Blind - Tom Fall Rmx 8. Shogun - 550 9. Orjan Nilsen - Atchoo 10. Sandro Silva and Quintino - Leave The Epic World Behind - Lionel.B Bootleg 11. Emma Hewitt - Colours - Cosmic Gate Rmx 12. Armin Van Buuren and Orjan Nilsen - Belter

item.itunes:summary:
Its guest mix time again, and may I present to you some local legends to me brothers and duo Luke and Joel Heaton. A truly epic trance mix for you this week from these two. Shall be gracing the white isle with both of them for the Hindsight Pres. Island Of Trance week in Ibiza this coming Sept so if you are there between 9th to 16th sept keep your eyes peeled for us.
Im taking a break for 2 weeks, so you shall be hearing back from me in mid June! Until then I leave you in the hands of these talented guys! ;) xXx
Luke and Joel Heaton bio.....
In 2001 at the tender age of 14 these two boys were introduced to the hard dance scene thanks to listening to Mark EG and M Zone tapes passed down from older friends and siblings, this was the start of their musical ambition which has progressed massively over the years.
Although both underage Luke and Joel started to attend dance events such as Slinky when they were just 16, this then progressed to bigger nights out and to a wider selection of different dance music genres up and down the country, as their love and passion for the music grew so did their interest in mixing.
The main musical focal points in the Luke and Joels sets are Trance and Hardtrance; however their abilitys to be able play almost anything has also seen them rock dance floors with House, Hardstyle and European Hardcore, this is something they feel is necessary these days as it opens more doors and allows them to play more freely.
In 2010 dreams became reality when the boys were asked by Nick the Kid to play in Ibiza for Hindsight, this saw them playing in some major clubs, one of them being the mighty Eden, where they played for Judgement Sundays alongside a star studded line up of DJs they could only dream of. As well as playing for other huge nights such as Tidy in Ibiza, they have also rocked pool parties and various other clubs and bars on the White Isle and gained themselves a fan base of people. They have since been back twice to play in Ibiza, this includes Hindsight’s massive September 2011 trip – An Island of Trance. Luke and Joel are thrilled to have been asked to return to Ibiza in 2012, In June and September which will see them play at some of the worlds biggest clubs and alongside some of the worlds biggest DJs yet again.
The duo's ambitions don't stop at mixing, however, they have also been working extremely hard on the production side of music. In 2011 they visited the Organ Donors studio and produced a track with them which has been released on Implosion Digital, they have also spent time with other local producers, having a more hands on approach and learning different styles which they hope will open up new ideas and visions to the pair until they are satisfied with creating that sound and feel they both love.
With Future sounds hosting a range of nights, and them both starting to become regular faces for Hindsight, not forgetting to mention the pairs return to Ibiza in June and September as well as many more other events to be playing for this year, the pair have come a long way from that first set in an empty room. They continue to work hard at what they love and push themselves in their mixing and producing, 2012 is set to be yet another amazing year for the Heatons!
Luke and Joels Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Luke-and-Joel-Heaton/251551374915124
Tracklisting:
1. Digital Self and Tek-Tonic - Origin 2. Ben Gold and Tritonal - Apex 3. Sander Van Doorn - Chasin 4. Scot Project - G 5. Cosmic Gate - Back to Earth - Arty Rmx 6. Marlo - Megalodon 7. Cosmic gate feat. Jes - Flying Blind - Tom Fall Rmx 8. Shogun - 550 9. Orjan Nilsen - Atchoo 10. Sandro Silva and Quintino - Leave The Epic World Behind - Lionel.B Bootleg 11. Emma Hewitt - Colours - Cosmic Gate Rmx 12. Armin Van Buuren and Orjan Nilsen - Belter

item.description:
A collection of gorgeous progressive and uplifting trance for you this week in episode 62 ‘The Flight’ it of course progresses on some techy stompers just to winde you up. Completely in love with the intro track By Dart Rayne and Yura Moonlight - The Night Time, lovely vocal layered on to some blissful summery progressive beats. Every track is a stunner. New one by Bilal El Aly - Seiche, complete stomper finishing with the legend that is Matt Skyer with Bad Trip, the drop is just naughty! Love it xXx

item.content:encoded:
Great guest mix for you this week, comes from London’s very talented Nick Van Kakaj! A stunning collection of uplifting beauties and some techier monsters to finish on in this episode! Aweseme mix from start to finish ♥

www.dj-krash.com

NICK VAN KUKAJ also know as DJ-KRASH is a happy man, and with good reason. He’s making the transition from talented young upstart to leading light in the echelons of trance - and beyond. NICK van KUKAJ

DJ-KRASH success in and playing quality tunes that both excite existing fans. “I think trance is becoming a broader term for a lot of different genres; it’s no longer a specific kind of music within the dance scene,” says Dj-krash. “Trance has elements of all different types of music. I play a lot of tracks that are labelled as progressive, tribal progressive, techno, trance, euphoric trance, vocal trance, melodic progressive and all types of hard dance. These days it’s really hard to label a specific sound. Styles are mutating and evolving into this all-over new sound, which is basically dance music going back to its roots. There’s so much good music out there and I don’t want to limit myself to just one style.”

1) Marlo - Whispers 2) Autumn - Air (John Dopping Remix) 3) Paul Oakenfold - Full Moon Party 4) Damien Was - Death Of Aphrodite 5) Jaden Merrick - Pristine 6) Reverse - Endless Journey 7) Manuel Le Seux - Capricorn 8) James Allen & Kevin Aitkin - Killswitch 9) Ron Van Den Bueken - Timeless 10) Talla 2XLC Vs Paul Miller - Extravaganza (Talla 2XLC Mix)

"I think trance is becoming a broader term for a lot of different genres; it's no longer a specific kind of music within the dance scene," says Dj-krash. "Trance has elements of all different types of music. I play a lot of tracks that are labelled as progressive, tribal progressive, techno, trance, euphoric trance, vocal trance, melodic progressive and all types of hard dance. These days it's really hard to label a specific sound. Styles are mutating and evolving into this all-over new sound, which is basically dance music going back to its roots. There's so much good music out there and I don't want to limit myself to just one style."

item.description: RE-UPLOADED DUE TO TECHNICAL ERROR FROM I-TUNES…. Sorry if you downloaded the 1st edition of this one, for some reason itunes was only giving downloads of 11mins out of an hour long mix? Sorry about that, I have uploaded again for you so please re download for the full edition, Thanks ……. Not that this episode is Disney themed or anything, I just fancied experimenting with photoshop for the cover, out came a Fantasy-land - Hence podcast 58 ‘Fantasy’! Some blissfull beats for you this week… Stunning intro track by Juventa. Loving Alex M.O.R.P.H’s mix of Sinead by Within Temptation and the Setrise remix of Cherry blossum by Marcel Woods! Ending on the harder Tech Trance side, journey from 130BPM to 141BPM…. Enjoy

item.dc:creator: franetic
item.description:
This months guest mix comes from a very talented fellow lady DJ from Manchester. Just the right blend of Uplifting/Proggy/Techy Trance for you to feast your ears on! xXx

Kate Remington is an aspiring female DJ with passion and talent in equal measures.  Her love affair with dance music started at the tender age of 11, when she would save her pocket money to buy Hardcore tape packs.  1999, saw Kate’s introduction to the clubbing scene, watching Paul Oakenfold, at the Mezzanine, Wolverhampton, and she has been a dedicated festival and club goer ever since. Her more personal involvement started at the age of 19, when she bought a set of turntables, and started to build up an impressive vinyl collection, initially playing mainly Hard-House and Hard-Trance. In the last couple of years, Kate has played predominately Trance with a Techno edge.  She lists he [...]
item.content:encoded:
This months guest mix comes from a very talented fellow lady DJ from Manchester. Just the right blend of Uplifting/Proggy/Techy Trance for you to feast your ears on! xXx

Kate Remington is an aspiring female DJ with passion and talent in equal measures.  Her love affair with dance music started at the tender age of 11, when she would save her pocket money to buy Hardcore tape packs.  1999, saw Kate’s introduction to the clubbing scene, watching Paul Oakenfold, at the Mezzanine, Wolverhampton, and she has been a dedicated festival and club goer ever since. Her more personal involvement started at the age of 19, when she bought a set of turntables, and started to build up an impressive vinyl collection, initially playing mainly Hard-House and Hard-Trance. In the last couple of years, Kate has played predominately Trance with a Techno edge.  She lists her influences as Markus Schulz, Mark Simz, Bart Claessen, Paul Oakenfold, Ferry Corsten, Armin van Buuren, BK, Andy Farley and Dave Clarke.  Kate had a stonking start to playing out in clubs, with an incredible opening set at Rong Manchester in May 2011! She has since played for Forward @ Stinkeys Leeds, Majefa in Manchester and the Legendary Howard pre-parties before Off the Rails in Sheffield!! Watch this space!!

Link to her podcast:>>>> http://ladyremington.podomatic.com

1) Arkadi and William Daniel-Skypark (original) 2) Pulser in deep (Pulsers main floor remix) 3) Alex m.o.r.p.h.and Protoculture- Waking up the stars (original) 4) Smart_apes-Phobia(original) 5) Ummet Ozcan - Miami Sundown (original) 6) The thrillseekers feat Fisher - The last time (Simon Bostock Remix) 7) Styller - Quantum Mechanics (original) 8) Paul Oakenfold - Glow in the dark 9) Gaia - Jai envie de toi (original_mix)

item.itunes:summary:
This months guest mix comes from a very talented fellow lady DJ from Manchester. Just the right blend of Uplifting/Proggy/Techy Trance for you to feast your ears on! xXx
Kate Remington is an aspiring female DJ with passion and talent in equal measures. Her love affair with dance music started at the tender age of 11, when she would save her pocket money to buy Hardcore tape packs. 1999, saw Kate's introduction to the clubbing scene, watching Paul Oakenfold, at the Mezzanine, Wolverhampton, and she has been a dedicated festival and club goer ever since. Her more personal involvement started at the age of 19, when she bought a set of turntables, and started to build up an impressive vinyl collection, initially playing mainly Hard-House and Hard-Trance. In the last couple of years, Kate has played predominately Trance with a Techno edge. She lists her influences as Markus Schulz, Mark Simz, Bart Claessen, Paul Oakenfold, Ferry Corsten, Armin van Buuren, BK, Andy Farley and Dave Clarke. Kate had a stonking start to playing out in clubs, with an incredible opening set at Rong Manchester in May 2011! She has since played for Forward @ Stinkeys Leeds, Majefa in Manchester and the Legendary Howard pre-parties before Off the Rails in Sheffield!! Watch this space!!
Link to her podcast: http://ladyremington.podomatic.com
1) Arkadi and William Daniel-Skypark (original) 2) Pulser in deep (Pulsers main floor remix) 3) Alex m.o.r.p.h.and Protoculture- Waking up the stars (original) 4) Smart_apes-Phobia(original) 5) Ummet Ozcan - Miami Sundown (original) 6) The thrillseekers feat Fisher - The last time (Simon Bostock Remix) 7) Styller - Quantum Mechanics (original) 8) Paul Oakenfold - Glow in the dark 9) Gaia - Jai envie de toi (original_mix)

item.dc:creator: franetic
item.description:
Episode 54 for you, an extremely techy mix with quite a hard edged ending for you this week. Really love Beat Service ‘Masquarade’ very cool tune! Matt Skyer has a wicked track in the mix with ‘Throwing Swords’, and as I mentioned finishing on a harder edge with David Rust’s track ‘Paradox’ Enjoy xXx

item.title: FranetiC - Traffic - Episode 53 ( Trance )
item.dc:creator: franetic
item.description: “The weekend has landed, all that exists is pubs, clubs, drugs and PODCASTS!” This weeks episode is Traffic ^^^ The above quote slightly adapted of course from the infamous movie ‘Human Traffic’ I thought it was quite fitting! Some wicked tunage for you this week, Armin Van Buurens new track ‘Suddenly Summer’ sounding rather awesome. Another offering from South West duo and friends of mine Digital Self & Tektonic with their bootleg of David Guetta’s Titanium, again sounding rather wicked! Ending the mix with my new track of 2012 so far John O’Callaghan’s mix of ‘Concrete Angel’ by Gareth Emery - Truly epic, makes the hairs on the back of my neck stand up! AMAZING! Enjoy

item.title: FranetiC - The Classics - Episode 52 ( Classic Trance | UK Hard Trance | Bounce | Hard House )
item.dc:creator: franetic
item.description:
All the classics for you this week, mostly unplayed stuff so far in my podcasts, feature a few tracks played before but in all honesty they are impossible to get bored of! A journey from classic Trance to classic Hard House/Hard Trance! This is a studio edit of a mix I performed out last Saturday night at Hard Energy in Hayle, Cornwall.

Enjoy xXx

1) Rhythm Of Life - You Put Me In Heaven With Your Touch (Lange Remix) 2) Signum Feat. Scott Mac - Coming On Strong (Original Mix) 3) Lost Witness - Happiness Happening (Lange Remix) 4) Dark Monks - Driving Me Insane (Steve Murano Remix) 5) Eye to Eye - Just Cant Get Enough (Original Mix) 6) Heavens Cry - Till Tears Do Us Part (Flash Harry Remix) [...]

item.title: FranetiC - Revolution - Episode 51 ( House | Trance | Tech Trance )
item.dc:creator: franetic
item.description:
Im back with a rather storming selection of tunes for you this week, Lots and lots of excellent promos have been filling my inbox in the last few weeks and this mix features many of those. Im completely in love with Andy Moors bootleg of Vangelis - Rachels Song, a stunning piece of music lifted from Blade Runner. Really in to Third Degree’s - Battery Acid, wicked tune was very pleased to recieve that one! John O’Callaghan also featuring a coupe of times, with his own track Smokscreen and his remix of Velvet! Enjoy xXx

1) Ibiza Duck - Paradiso (Original Mix) 2) Jon O’Bir & Sonic Element - Let Go (Sebastian Montanao Remix) 3) Vangelis - Rachel’s Song (Andy Moor Remix) [...]

item.title: Tommie Quick - March 2012 Guest Mix - Episode 50 ( Tough House | Electro | Tech Trance | Tech Dance )
item.dc:creator: franetic
item.description:
To celebrate the 50th episode of my podcast I have a very special guest for you…. Local Southwest hero Tommie Quick! A wicked mix of Tough House, Electro and Trance ending up on a rather tasty Tech Dance note for you! Tommie has been DJing since he was 11, 19 years in total. He started off doing partys as a mobile DJ then played his first club set when he was 15. Resident at the famous Dance Academy and various other nights accross Plymouth and the whole UK…. Honestly one of my favourite local DJ’s. Me and my friends have always made an effort to see him play when he’s on line up, very talented guy! Really happy to have him guest mix for me for March 2012! Enjoy!!! xXx

1) Intro 2) Bingo Players - Toms Diner 3) Sedutive - Take Control 4) Swedish House Mafia - Save The World 5) Benny Benassi - Hit My Heart 6) Hardwell vs Calvin Harris - Alright [...]

item.title: FranetiC - The Helix - Episode 49 ( Electro | Tough Prog | Uplifting Trance | Tech Trance )
item.dc:creator: franetic
item.description:
A journey from Uplifting Electro to the finest Tech Trance this week. Some really awesome tracks for you to discover in this mix, and there are some belters out there atm! Loving ‘The hardest thing’ By Filo and Peri, ‘Ultra’ by Chris Schweizer and Jorn Van Deyhovens take on ‘The real you’ Cant just pick out those 3, every track is PHAT! 2 former Hard House legends shining through this week with their tracks, Lisa Lashes and Nick Sentience are on top form! Some epic techy drops towards the end, understandabley when you hear them played in clubs, you just want to shout at the DJ! They are just too good!!! Enjoy xXx

1) The Wizard - Alien Planet (Orchestral Intro Mix) 2) Super 8 & Tab - Awakenings (Original Mix) 3) Filo & Peri Feat. Sarah Cr [...]

item.title: FranetiC - Soundwave - Episode 48 ( Trance | Tech Trance )
item.dc:creator: franetic
item.description:
Back from a 2 week break, Some big name producers in this week including good old Armin Van Buuren, a reminder of his more classic trance style in my opionion with Orbion, really nice track. Also this week a really wicked reamix of classic trance track ‘Tears from the Moon’, alongside loads of wicked promos this week including a friend of mine Tektonic who features a couple of times with his awesome collaberations with Digital Self and Daam of Skyler and Robin Swartz’s mix of Cerebro. A techier beat heavy mix this week! Enjoy xXx

1) Jace Williams - Always Remembered (Original Mix) 2) Armin Van Buuren - Orbion (Extended Version) 3) Elles De Graaf - Tears From The Moon (Sam Stroke & Isaac Fisherman Remix) 4) Tritonal - Slave (Tritonal & Ben Gold Club Dub) 5) [...]

item.title: Aaron Cook - February Guest Mix - Episode 47 ( House | Electro )
item.dc:creator: franetic
item.description:
February’s guest mix, this month local legend Aaron Cook takes to the decks for us, with a Touch Prog & Electro House mix.

In his short but sharp rise in his Djing career Aaron is going from strength to strength! Building a good reputation for his tight flawless mixing and excellent knowlege and selection of tunes, he definately knows how to read what the crowd wants.
